Reviews.Content: Near Uffizi We chose it because of its nearness to the Uffizi and Ponte Vecchio. Room is very small for triple sharing 鈧?50( 1 queen, 1 foldable bed ). Toilet is half the size of the room , toilet heater did not work very well ). Room is heated upon your instruction.You let yourself in the main hotel door after 10.30pm with a key. Lift , big enough for 3 adults with no luggage, is coded for privacy. Roof top garden sees part of the famous bridge and river.That said, staff is efficient, communicative and friendly. They helped make a telephone reservation for the Uffizi at no charge ( 鈧? extra payable to Uffizi for prebooking )Very light breakfast served.
Reviews.Author: wonder-luster

Reviews.Content: Fab location - lovely hotel Stayed at the Hermitage Hotel August 08. Tricky to find as its in a little alleyway, but it is a lovely hotel for a 2-3 star. The staff were very helpful, and we had been upgraded to a room with a Jacuzzi bath. The room was decorated in a traditional Florentine style - very charming and was lovely and clean and though the bathroom was tiny - it did have the jacuzzi!The rest of the hotel is nice - a lovely light breakfast room and drawing room and a fab rooftop garden with great views.Location fantastic as you are next to the Ponte Vecchio, 2mins walk to the Uffizi and 5 mins to the Duomo.The only downside would be for drivers - the garage came to collect our car and dropped it off again for us, but it costs a lot of money - it was about 鈧?0 for 2 nights parking! But apart from that I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a weekend break in Florence.
Reviews.Author: Sam2957

Reviews.Content: Good location       (Enter your caption here -Our morning cappuccinos made us smile required)
Reviews.Author: Larep

Reviews.Content: Faded Fusty Hotel We booked into the Hermitage having read the review on cntraveller.com. Unfortunately the hotel was not the gem promised albeit that the location is excellent. The moment you enter into the lift it is abundently clear that the hotel is in dire need of refurbishment. When we got to the room we were met with faded wallpaper, chipped woodwork and a gastly bed and linen. The room was also extremely small and while the view of the Ponte Vecchio is lovely it does come with the associated road noise as well. We decided to check out immediately and the staff were helpful in that they did not charge us any cancellation fee. Whilst this may have been expected in a budget hotel at 190 euros a night it is simply not worth the money by a long way. The hotel is trading on location alone.
Reviews.Author: sjb_8

Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the Hermitage       The parlor
Reviews.Author: jazzgirl04

Reviews.Content: Room with a View I loved my room on the rooftop -- it felt very private and quiet even though there were some tables outside. (The room itself did not have the view -- but step out on the patio just outside, and enjoy a beautiful vista!) The location of this hotel could not be beat -- right at the Ponte Vecchio. Our group ranged in age from 8 to 85, and we all felt comfortable at this hotel. The service at the desk was excellent. Breakfast was served in a lovely room on the 5th floor (very small buffet; pay extra for eggs); and there was a lovely sitting room where we enjoyed a glass of wine before dinner one evening. Only downside was that one of the rooms, a small suite being shared by 3 of us, smelled odd; the hotel made up for it by moving the group into two separate rooms at the same cost. Based on the location and excellent service, I think this is a wonderful place to stay.
Reviews.Author: ItalyLadies

Reviews.Content: Location is its greatest strength We stayed at the Hotel Hermitage for four nights at the end of April 2008. Overall, the hotel was charming and reasonably priced. It's strongest suit is indeed its location -- a half a block from the Ponte Vecchio and another half block from the Ufitzi. The Duomo is a five minute walk away. The Hermitage's staff was also quite friendly, offering to make us reservations and other assistance at any time. The breakfast isn't bad (standard continental) and the roof-top terrace is a lovely bonus.A couple of complaints. When we first checked in, we were taken to a 4th floor room in which the prior guests had clearly been smoking. The lingering acrid scent of the smoke was unmistakable from the first moment we opened the door. The front desk said that the prior guests shouldn't have been smoking in the room, but it's unclear how the staff could have overlooked the odor. (Notably, there was a wall partially, but significantly, obstructing the view from the 4th floor room to the river.)Appropriately, though, the hotel offered us two alternatives -- an interior room on a high floor (without a river view) or a first floor room with a river view, adjacent to the street traffic. We opted for the first-floor room. It wasn't bad, albeit a big run down. The bathroom was clean and functional. The noise from the street was bearable, and the view (not obstructed) was fantastic.Our more serious complaint was that the bed in the room was not a true double bed. Two singles had been pushed together, leaving a noticdable and uncomfortable gap. We are generally heavy sleepers, but after the first night, we placed the extra blankets in the room under the sheets to bridge the gap a little more. It made the bed bearable, but plainly it was not comparable to a proper double bed.Would we return? Probably, but we would insist on a true double bed and a room with an unobstructed view of the river. All in all, the location is pretty exceptional for the price.
Reviews.Author: Wandering_Misfit

Reviews.Content: Ponte Vecchio Bridge This is a lovely hotel with great service. Our room was tiny for two people but all that was available and since we rarely spent any time in it wasn't really a problem. The beautiful roof top terrace is the perfect place to enjoy the views and have an end of the day glass of wine or drink. You can have breakfast (which is very basic but included) on the terrace or in the dining room. There is also a lounge with a bar where you can curl up with a book. Being right at the end of the Ponte Vecchio Bridge you are in the perfect place to explore the city.
Reviews.Author: geminigemini

Reviews.Content: Excellent location!!! We stayed at the Hermitage on the recommendation of one of our firm鈥檚 Partners, who is an aficionado of Italy, and were delighted that we鈥檇 taken his advice. Fantastic location, ideal for exploring the city, and the gin  tonics delivered to you on the roof terrace were excellent.
Reviews.Author: JMF70

Reviews.Content: Favorite stop on our Italy Trip.... We stayed at Hermitage in April with our little son. Excellent location. Comfortable room. Clean very white bathroom. Listened to Beethoven's 9th Symphony from our window in back of hotel in the church in the courtyard - priceless. The women at the reception were great and made many excellent restaurant recommendations. People complain about the 10 steps up to elevator - not sure why - we never carried a thing up those stairs ourselves...... other than our little son.
Reviews.Author: JNS_CALI

Reviews.Content: fine hotel This is a fine hotel with a GREAT location....30 seconds from the Ponte Vecchio and 75 seconds to the Uffizzi!!! There are some stairs to get to the lobby..but the staff is quite accomodating!!The rooms are very nice..clean with a nice bathroom and shower!! Size wise, pretty good for an Italian hotel...Breakfasts are fair, but you can get eggs and bacon for 3 euros extra(3 for eggs and 3 for bacon).Beware of the safe...I could not open mine and nearly had a heart attack, BUT the staff was able to open it which had our passports!!Please try the restaurant Palio on Via Tavolini(? spelling) right near the Piazza Signora...it's great!!Paid 250 euros for a triple which is pretty competative
Reviews.Author: sak01

Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel in Florence Nothing could beat the location of this hotel just steps from the Ponte Vecchio and within walking distance of everywhere we went in Florence (museums, restaurants, shopping). The staff was very helpful. While the rooms were small, the bathrooms were very large and well appointed. We had two rooms: one overlooked the Ponte Vecchio and the other had a small balcony overlooking the city (we could see the Duomo and the Government Building). Other reviewers complained about the noise on the Ponte Vecchio side of the building but our daughters had no noise problem at all. We all loved this hotel and would stay there again when visiting Florence.
Reviews.Author: needstraveladvice

Reviews.Content: wonderful... fablous lacation at the beginning of the ponte veccio... nice inside room. quiet and great staff. very nice hotel with a great bathroom. good beds.
Reviews.Author: la4tuna

Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in great area       on Ponte Vecchio which is steps from hotel
Reviews.Author: jessemh431

Reviews.Content: Has It's Positives (Roof Garden) and Negatives The positives include the wonderful rooftop garden that overlooks the city on one side and the river on the other. Breakfast is served either there or in a nice breakfast room. We spent many happy evenings in the garden reading or having a bottle of wine and conversation with fellow travellers. The room I had was large with a great bathroom - wonderful tub/shower combo. On the negative side - absolutely avoid rooms on the front of the hotel (which have the view of the river - and the Ponte Vecchio a half block away). Those in our party in a front room didn't sleep because of the street noise. I booked on the back (following advice from a prior Trip Advisor review) which had some noise (with windows open) until 11 p.m. but was quiet after that. This hotel has good facilities but could use an update - carpets and bedspreads are showing wear. Also be aware that the front desk isn't staffed after 10:30 p.m. Still, the location is central to the museums and shopping - and to the better resturants which are a short walk across the river from the tourist area - so I would return again.
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGirl54

Reviews.Content: Good location The best thing about this hotel is the location - perhaps 25 yards from the Ponte Vecchio. Otherwise this is not an impressive place. The room was small, even by European standards, although the bathroom was O.K. Breakfast was limited and they had an additional menu for things you might get free elsewhere. And they served canned fruit cocktail! The staff was not terribly friendly, but extremely efficient. Overall an acceptable place to stay, and you probably won't do any better in Florence, but don't expect much.
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedTravelers

Reviews.Content: What a Gem Spent three days at the Hermitage and loved this charming hotel. The location near the Ponte Vecchio may be a bit noisy during the day, but with the window and shutters closed, it is fine for sleeping. The Roof Garden and Breakfast Room are something to be seen. The staff is extremely helpful and English speaking. The twin beds are small but comfortable. We loved this hotel and would most certainly stay there next time.
Reviews.Author: caseyLI

Reviews.Content: Charming hotel, great location, great value! We stayed here for 3 nights and it was a perfect spot in Florence. Our room was rather large, very clean and the bed was quite comfortable. The breakfast was rather good and everyone was very helpful and attentive. The location cannot be beat and the view from the roof deck is amazing. Great experience for the cost. All in all, we would stay here again if we are in Florence.
Reviews.Author: smcnd02

Reviews.Content: Everyone should stay here The location  accomodations were excellent. The rooms were very nicely decorated, clean and had large bathrooms with jacuzzi tubs (a welcome relief for tired feet). The roof top balcony is a wonderful place to rest between sight-seeing. The gellateria downstairs is very good as well. This is a great value.
Reviews.Author: Miwa&Ninja

Reviews.Content: Great Location!!!       The terrace for breakfast
Reviews.Author: California-Margie

Reviews.Content: great location and service! Pros:Great location! You cannot beat the location. It is literally off of the Ponte Vecchio. When you step out of your hotel all you have to do is turn right and the bridge is right there! There is a cute little Gelato stand right outside the hotel as well.Great Rooms! We paid 230 Euros for our room and it had a living room, nice jacuzzi bathroom and a spacious bedroom with a window view of a courtyard square below. It was clean and the air conditioning, water pressure, etc. were perfect.Great Staff! The front desk was so very helpful and took care of all of our needs. They reserved us museum tickets at the last minute, ordered our laundry service and even gave me a needle and thread when I needed it!If you are looking for a hotel with a central location, larger than average European lodging, great price and excellent staff look no further than Hotel Hermitage!!!
Reviews.Author: cloud9shopper

Reviews.Content: Perfect Florence Location We enjoyed our stay at the Hermitage very much. Our room was on the hotel's first floor (two flights up from the street). Our windows faced a courtyard while some rooms faced the Arno River. We had a little night noise from the courtyard (people wandering home from a long evening, mostly), but the hotel was surprisingly peaceful and quiet considering that it was only a block from the extremely busy Ponte Vecchio. The bathroom and sleeping room were both large enough to be comfortable. We enjoyed the jacuzzi tub, the antique furnishings, the large windows and the tasteful decor, as well. It was very easy to get around Florence from the hotel. We were a block away from the Uffizi and only a few blocks each from Pitti Palace, the shopping area and the Duomo; it was very easy to walk everywhere we wanted to go. The staff was helpful and they all communicated easily in English. Breakfast may have been the best part - the view from the 6th floor terrace where breakfast was served was exquisite. We had juice, fresh pastries and cappuccinos every morning; for a nominal fee, we sometimes added eggs and bacon. The hotel lounge was also a very cozy place (like a living room) where one could read a newspaper, have a cocktail or just chat with others. All in all, quite charming. We recommend it.
Reviews.Author: Much2Learn

Reviews.Content: style and location We stayed with the Hermitage Hotel for 4 nights the end of July, begining of August. the location is ourstanding, and matched by the service. our room we an average size for this area, but very comfortable. the bathroom was fairly large. the staff was very helpful and friendly. i would stay here again given the chance to return to florence.
Reviews.Author: nam-ram

Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but remember the code.... Nice and clean with a lovely roof balcony. Note that after 10.30 in the evening you need a code to get in. If not you must wake up the night porter which was not very easy to do. Thanks again to the lovely couple from Ohio which remembered the code...Overall a good place to stay.
Reviews.Author: Leifaa

Reviews.Content: Hermitage Heaven Our group of four booked two rooms at this lovely hotel in early June, 2006. Before we even checked in, we were greeted by name, as if they were expecting us like family! The first room overlooked the river--the view was beautiful. The bedroom of this room was a good size, but the bathroom was small. The second room looked over a little courtyard where a 12th C. church was located. This room had a tiny bedroom but a large bathroom with a jacuzzi. Both rooms were nicely appointed, the beds were comfortable, the soaps and toiletries very nice. The staff was so friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was good (even though they served canned fruit along with the toast and criossants). There is a restaurant right outside the entrance to the hotel, Buca dell Orafo, where we had one of the very best meals of our entire trip throughout Italy. Just across the Ponte Vecchio is a lunch restaurant, Celestina, which was also very good. We loved the location of this hotel and had such a good time in Florence.
Reviews.Author: mh999

Reviews.Content: Location, comfort, we would stay there again! Great location right at the base of the Pont Alba (you almost walk on to the bridge when you walk our the hotel) and right next to the Uffizi, but rooms are remarkably quiet. Very comfortable and modern bathrooms. Wonderful roof top terrace with great views of the city ( and a nice place for the simple but good breakfast). We thought the room was more spacious than most comparable three star Italian hotels, and did I say the location just can not be beat? Nice gelato stand right outside the door! We would unquesstionably select again for a Florence stay based on location, comfort and value.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Charming hotel in a perfect location! We stayed at the Hotel Hermitage from December 25-29, 2005 and we were totally charmed. First, this is a 3 star hotel, not a 2 star (as this website has it listed). My husband and I stayed there with my parents and they gave us rooms across from each other tucked away at the end of a hall, which felt very cozy. The elevator is very tiny, but the bellhops are pros and somehow manage very well with everyone's luggage. Our rooms had jacuzzis which, while not top of the line, were lovely after a snow-filled day walking around Florence. The breakfast and sitting rooms are what make this place special - very nicely decorated and serve good breakfasts and coffee. It was a treat to have such a nice breakfast included in our room, especially since we all quickly tired of the pastry and cappucino breakfasts we spent a week eating in Rome. The best part about this place is the location - the best you will find in Florence. It is literally right across from the Ponte Vecchio and central to everything.
Reviews.Author: ShiraU

Reviews.Content: loved it - great location We had stayed here once before for two nights and enjoyed this hotel then. We stayed there again and weren't disappointed. Because our plans changed, we stayed an additional two days and moved to another room. The hotel was very clean, the staff was very accomodating and the location is excellent - just off the Ponte Vecchio. If you are looking for a very quiet hotel, you may want to ask for a room that faces the courtyard behind. Because it is right near a road, there is noise. We stayed the first three nights in a room with the jacuzzi - the bathroom was good sized. The other two nights, the bathroom was on the smaller side. You can't beat the rooftop area with the view of the city and the location - walking distance everywhere. There is a lovely sitting area - one quiet evening when we had already had too much food, we sat in there and read and relaxed.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Your typical three star The web reviews really build this place up - but if you travel, you know what a 3 star is - and this is exactly what it reports to be - nothing special. On the plus side it is right down town and not too expensive (everything in Florence is expensive). The rooms are clean and the staff friendly. If you are just looking for a room for the night - it's fine.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel My family stayed at the Hermitage for three wonderful days in September. The hotel was perfect in every way: as close to the Ponte Vecchio that you can get without falling into the Arno, and just over the bridge from one of the best gelato shops in the world (try the panna cota!) Breakfast is on the spectacular roof terrace with stunning views or in the ultra charming dining room and in either case, the staff is superb, the breakfast perfect and the cappucinos memorable. Our room for three was actually a two room suite with beautiful etchings and a window overlooking a charming old church piazza. The bathroom was large with a jacuzzi tub and a velvet pouch of bath products for each of us!The hotel is centrally located within short walking distance to the best of Florence. The staff is particularly helpful. The New York Times is right: this is the best value in Florence!
Reviews.Author: amicus1945

Reviews.Content: Best location in Florence Based on two stays there, in Spring of 2002 and Fall of 2004: Unquestionably the best location in Florence! Thirty seconds to walk to Ponte Vechio, two minutes to walk to Uffizze. Very convenient to go anywhere, do anything and get back to your room easily. Although the rooms are small, we found it to be very quiet, clean and comfortable, and the service was impeccable, which is standard in Italian hotels. TripAdvisor has wrong information on the hotel class, it is a three star hotel. It is as good as any four star hotel without the large meeting facilities and pool. There is no hotel restaurant, but you don't need one. It's not cheap - you pay for the location, but it is worth it.
Reviews.Author: roadgard

Reviews.Content: Lovely and Located We stayed in high season -- two very nice rooms at the back. No river view, but nicely furnished and quiet. Decent modern bathrooms and good airconditioning. Small hotel, which we prefer.Location is superb -- steps from the action, but with a delightful rooftop garden for breakfast and drinks. Feels homey (although a few too many Americans) and great to dive into for rests when on the gallop.Staff attentive and helpful.Only snag was AC went out in one room for two days! but they offered a room change and did fix it.We travel a LOT and recommend this small, mid-range hotel.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Well, I don't know       Additional views from window
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: i hate to give out my secret great little hotel--unbelievable location--very nice and clean in the italian style--real pleasure--eager to return
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Can't Wait to Go Back! We ended up at the Hermitage after a mix up at another hotel left us without a room for the night. We liked the hotel so much that we extended our stay an additional two nights. Admittedly the room was small, even by European standards, but it was clean, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was modern and spacious. The public rooms, i.e., the breakfast room, rooftop garden and lounge were cozy and beautifully decorated. The staff were the nicest and most helpful I have encountered in my many travels.Despite what other reviewers have said, we loved the location. The Ponte Vecchio is so beautiful and located near restaurants, museums and shopping. We weren't bothered by noise at all. In fact my favorite memory is falling asleep at night with the window open being serenaded by a flutist who was playing hauntingly beautiful music on the bridge. In the morning we woke up to the sound of churchbells ringing. I could have stayed there forever!
Reviews.Author: dw

Reviews.Content: Cramped rooms are overpriced and noisy If you want similar accomodations to the room we stayed in, save some money and stay at a hostel. They do have some spacious rooms -- my wife stayed here 3 years ago in a very nice quiet room. However, this year they put us in a cramped tiny room where you could still hear the noisy traffic going by all night. The morning breakfast on the roof was good with a nice view, and the staff are very friendly and helpful. But its not worth the price to feel like your at a YMCA hotel.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Just Returned The Hotel Hermitage is at the most an average Florence hotel. We found the rooms cramped and overpriced, although very clean and very convenient. If we return to Florence we will not stay at the Hermitage. We will select a hotel a little closer to the Duomo.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Perfect for us!! Our room was under 170e and was a great value. It is right on Ponte Vecchio and truly within walking distance of ALL the main attractions/museums. Rooms are fairly typical but the jaccuzi bath/shower was fantastic - best bathroom in our 5 hotel trip. The garden top breakfast area was lovely and relaxing. We had no street noise. It was very, very nice for the money. Highly recommend it!!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A real gem! We found this hotel to be a hidden gem, with friendly staff, in an amazing location, at a great value. In addition, we visited Florence during an amazing heat wave, and the Hotel Hermitage is Air Conditioned. Much of Florence is not! It was so hot during our stay that we would return to our room every afternoon to cool off before venturing out into the heat again. The breakfast up on the terrace was charming, with beautiful views. My only suggestion would be for staff to work on discouraging the flock of birds who tend to swoop down on tables. The building itself is very old, but so is Florence, and that is half the reason to visit. We found the room to be simple but full of old world charm, and the bathroom was actually quite large and very modern. The shower was amazing(it came in handy during the heatwave...)We would certainly return!
Reviews.Author: cradlemom

Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, perfect location, A+ We stayed in the Hermitage in December 2003 and had a wonderful time. The room was spacious and the bathroom had an amazing jacuzzi tub--the perfect respite after an overnight flight from the United States that led right into a full day of walking around Florence. The staff was very helpful and they do offer a breakfast (you pay about $10 a person extra for it, like most everything in Europe) that looked good, though we opted to find a street cafe instead. They also have a beautiful rooftop garden that was flowering and green, even in December. A wonderful find and not too pricey for Florence. You can negotiate prices for offseason stays.
Reviews.Author: reegieluigi

Reviews.Content: Great Experience! We had a great time at the Hermitage in May of 2003. The room was not too big - but the nice jacuzzi tub made up for it after a long rainy day of site seeing/shopping!!! Ask for a room facing the Arno...we could open the windows and view the river from our room with a glass of wine after the day out! The rooftop terrace was the best place to enjoy breakfast or a glass of wine in the afternoon. This was the best place to take a picture of the Ponte Vecchio too!We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The staff was helpful and kind and the hotel had the BEST location. Great gelato right outside the hotel door too!I would highly recommend this hotel if you want a small, intimate, charming, italian style hotel. The old world charm with modern/clean/new bathrooms was the perfect combination. I would go back!!
Reviews.Author: mgfit

Reviews.Content: Can't wait to go back!   showReview(1563734, 'full');
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: fabulous!   showReview(1552355, 'full');
Reviews.Author: 2travelrs

Reviews.Content: Suboptimal room   showReview(1511712, 'full');
Reviews.Author: PortlandSunseeker

Reviews.Content: A little threadbear and a little over-run with tourists traffic   showReview(1447281, 'full');
Reviews.Author: elaineandbrad

Reviews.Content: Great Location!   showReview(1231114, 'full');
Reviews.Author: drdkc

Reviews.Content: Fantastico!   showReview(1230836, 'full');
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: In the midst of history   showReview(1222712, 'full');
Reviews.Author: Tomtopes

Reviews.Content: near ponte vecchio   showReview(1072178, 'full');
Reviews.Author: tbplaw

Reviews.Content: Terrace With a View   showReview(987920, 'full');
Reviews.Author: katieself

Reviews.Content: What You want In Your Florence Hotel   showReview(853477, 'full');
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: 娆°倐蹇呫仛銇撱伄銉涖儐銉伀锛?#x201d;   showReview(20710478, 'full');
Reviews.Author: Hiroko銆€Allen

Reviews.Content: 銉欍偣銉堛儹銈便兗銈枫儳銉炽仹銇欍亴銆併仭銈囥仯銇ㄩ珮銇勩亱銇紵   showReview(19496362, 'full');
Reviews.Author: Ronpapa
